thread.title: Former NBI officials charged in Korean kidnap-slay case
thread.title_full: Former NBI officials charged in Korean kidnap-slay case

author: Rappler.com
title: Former NBI officials charged in Korean kidnap-slay case

organizations.name: the philippine national police anti-kidnapping group

text:
Philippines Former NBI officials charged in Korean kidnap-slay case Former NBI officials Roel Boliv, Ricardo Diaz, and Jose Yap are named new respondents in a supplemental criminal complaint Published 6:24   6:24   
MANILA, Philippines â€“ The Philippine National Police Anti-Kidnapping Group (PNP-AKG) on Wednesday, February 22, charged 3 National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) officials in relation to the kidnapping and death of South Korean businessman Jee Ick Joo back in October 2016. 
The following were named new respondents in a supplemental criminal complaint filed by the PNP-AKG with the Department of Justice (DOJ): former NBI deputy director for investigation services Jose "Jojo" Yap former National Capital Region (NCR) director Ricardo Diaz former Task Force against Illegal Drugs head Roel Boliv 
The 3 NBI officials were tagged by Superintendent Rafael Dumlao, the official of the PNP Anti-Illegal Drugs Group (AIDG) who allegedly led the kidnapping of Jee. 
DOJ Secretary Vitaliano Aguirre II ordered their relief from duty. 
Additional respondents include the following 5 employees of the Gream funeral parlor, where the body of Jee was cremated and disposed: Epephany Gotera
